{{Infobox person |birth_date={{birth date and age|1981|4|1}} |birth_place=[[Ottawa|Ottawa, Ontario]], Canada |occupation=artist, animator |nationality=[[Canadians|Canadian]] }} '''Barry Bradfield''' (born April 1, 1981) is a [[Canadians|Canadian]] artist. From June 1994 to July 1997 his untitled comic strip was published in the [[Ottawa Citizen]]. The comic, usually one-panel in length, ranged in topics from political humour to slices of life.
In 1998, Bradfield created ''Batman: The Animated Homepage'' which featured information and images from [[Batman: The Animated Series]]. Following a merger with ''Superman: The Animated Message Board'' created by James Harvey, the site became The World's Finest. Bradfield has since left the site to pursue other interests.
Bradfield has been creating original material and characters since 1994 including his [[superhero]] genre parody "Sinus-Man". He also collaborated with Mike Jakubinek on their spy genre parody, "James Bean: Double-Oh-Nothing" which was featured in an [[animated]] short in 2002.
Barry Bradfield holds a diploma in Animation Television from [[Algonquin College]]. He currently works as a freelance toy designer for [[Art Asylum]] and [[Diamond Comic Distributors|Diamond Select Toys]],<ref name="Basement24.com">[http://www.basement24.com/profile.html Basement24.com]</ref><ref>[http://www.wizarduniverse.com/052908minimates.html WizardUniverse.com] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080602021045/http://www.wizarduniverse.com/052908minimates.html |date=June 2, 2008 }}</ref> and is illustrating an upcoming children's book to be published by Bunkhouse Press.<ref name="Basement24.com"/><ref>[http://www.bunkhousepress.com/content/new/ BunkHousePress.com] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081121084525/http://www.bunkhousepress.com/content/new/ |date=November 21, 2008 }}</ref>
